page.title: 08MYTTON MILL - FORTON HEATH
page.content:
Until 1966 this was a working flour mill, but its flour prices became uncompetitive and the mill was closed. The building then lay derelict until 1971 when it was purchased by a local firm of building contractors who used it as their headquarters. In 1982 a fire caused extensive damage to the building and it was decided to totally restore the building.
It is now sub_divided into a number of workshops which are let to various small firms. These presently include glass engravers, ceramic workers, screen_printers, woodturners, double glaziers, removal contractors, car mechanics plus the headquarters and workshops of the building contractors.
It is also a lovely building in a beautifull setting.
